name: Ru Lai Vegetarian food (Blk24 Sin Ming Road)

reviews.text:
My husband and I simply love their laksa. It comes with full boiled egg and generous tou pok and zai er. The laksa gravy is different from the other vegetarian stores. No wonder their laksa is sold out before 10am.
We also like their carrot cake, soup noodles and hor fun. The bosses ensure the food is prepared well and delivery their best to serve every customer. I truly appreciate them doing this.
Value for money, popular vegetarian food stall. Been dining here since 1999. The taste and service are good till now.

Foods still as yummy as old days!

Swift cooking n excellent service!
In less than 15mins, all our 8 dishes out le! üòç Awesome!!!

They also very nice in providing a lighter, paper plates n spoons for us when we requested for it to eat birthday cake üç∞!!!

It's not in a restaurant!
Yet their service is tip top!!! üëçüèªüëçüèªüëçüèªüëçüèªüëçüèª
2 eggs with rice for $3.60. Not much else to say. In fact I'm quite speechless. I know Singapore is expensive, but definitely not this expensive.

@Ru Lai Vegetarian food (Sin Ming Road)
@24 Sin Ming Rd, #01-51, Singapore 571024

Rice with 3 dishes were SG$4.00
The leaflygreen vegetables were OK..
Curry vegetable was OK
The bitter gourd eggs was good.
The vinegar green chillies was good and the red paste chillies was hot and spicy but its sweetness was a bit overwhelming...
The brown rice Á≥ôÁ±≥È•≠ was served neither hot nor even warm... was quite disappointed that they did not managed to kept them hot or warm when serving... same goes to the dishes which were not warm at all...
Could not raised their credit higher as their overall were just average...
